intro: Majorana dubia, commonly known as the wild marjoram, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, pale blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are narrow and have a strong, spicy aroma reminiscent of thyme and oregano. Majorana dubia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
